page.title: 06BRANDON HALL HOTEL,COVENTRY.
page.content: The old part of the hotel was built in the 1600's as a shooting lodge. James Beech bought it in the late 1800's.With his family he moved into the shooting lodge after improving it and it became known as Brandon Hall. The Manor House deteriorated into ruins.A descendant of James Beech commissioned the building of Brandon Club and Brandon School and another descendant set up polo grounds at the Hall.The Duke of Windsor played here many times.A local farmer now grazes sheep on the polo grounds,to the east of the hotel. In Brandon Little Wood, formerly part of the Hall, there is an ice-well.This was used for preserving game shot in the Manor Grounds. After World War II ended the Manor land was split between the villagers who were tenants.In 1946 the Hall was made into a 25 bedroom hotel.
